metadata.title: CVE-2021-46900 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Sympa before 6.2.62 relies on a cookie parameter for certain securityobjectives, but does not ensure that this parameter exists and has anunpredictable value. Specifically, the cookie parameter is both a salt forstored passwords and an XSS protection mechanism.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sympa - 6.2.66~dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sympa package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.66~dfsg-2').
